column2: the small plates and appetizers don't compare to Tiger Den. This is where the two differ the most. However
column3: the discrepancy between the ramen isn't as far apart
column4: especially if you're in the mood for a chicken based broth. Even though the Tokyo Yatai was my third favorite
column5: it was still alright. There's no doubt in my mind that they can improve and I hope they do. Their quick success highlights the demand Houstonians have for an inner loop ramen restaurant
column6: which will hopefully push for more openings in the future
